formal_accuser.name: René de Villier
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: neighbor/community member who called her witch and was charged by her husband in consequence

confession.seduction_context: out gathering wood, and 'forte desolée et affligée' because their cattle were dead

sabbat_activities: burning bodies of 2 stillborn children to obtain powder

testimony.threat_quote: que si le fils de ribaulde pouvoit tant faire qu'elle fut bruslée (combien qu'elle espere en dieu qu'il n'y poulra advenir) qu'il y en y aura encore d'aultres plus riches qu'elle qui seront bruslées
told servant to say nothing or harm might come to him

testimony.quarrel_subject: refusal to lend rope after witness's servant dropped bucket in well
testimony.threat_quote: asked where 'la maulvaise femme de ceans' was
remark on cart that others with greater means would follow her

testimony.quarrel_subject: caught her throwing pot against stable door of his brother-in-law, called her witch and threatened to burn her
testimony.threat_quote: She replied that he should say nothing, and he would have no more losses

testimony.quarrel_subject: father caught Sennelle throwing water against stable door
testimony.threat_quote: second time said it would not harm him

testimony.threat_quote: qu'une partie couroient fort et qu'ilz poulroient bien estre fichéz plus avant en l'affaire qu'elle

testimony.threat_quote: threat that if she was burned bigger people than her would also be burned

timeline.subject: René de Villier
timeline.details: René de Villier, who is in prison after calling accused witch and being charged by her husband, asks to be made partie formelle. Substitut for PG asks court at Dieuze to have her arrested.

timeline.subject: Synnelle femme Schneyder Hanns
timeline.details: First interrogation of accused, she denies all charges

timeline.subject: Synnelle femme Schneyder Hanns
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses, no reproaches, denied all charges

timeline.subject: Synnelle femme Schneyder Hanns
timeline.details: Substitut for PG asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Synnelle femme Schneyder Hanns
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - confessed as soon as lifted clear of ground

timeline.subject: Synnelle femme Schneyder Hanns
timeline.details: C.M. Rémy asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Synnelle femme Schneyder Hanns
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence after repetition of confessions freely

timeline.subject: Synnelle femme Schneyder Hanns
timeline.details: Sentence pronounced in courtyard of château, confessions read out, and execution takes place

accomplices_named.context: present at sabbat with her daughter Catherine

accomplices_named.context: ensign at sabbat with flag of black silk

accomplices_named.name: wife of the Gro Maire

notable_quotes.speaker: Synnelle femme Schneyder Hanns
notable_quotes.french: que si le fils de ribaulde pouvoit tant faire qu'elle fut bruslée (combien qu'elle espere en dieu qu'il n'y poulra advenir) qu'il y en y aura encore d'aultres plus riches qu'elle qui seront bruslées
notable_quotes.english: that if the son of a whore could do so much that she would be burned (although she hopes in God that it will not happen) there will be others richer than her who will be burned
notable_quotes.context: said when she was on cart to be brought to Dieuze

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicklass Cordonnier
notable_quotes.french: O dieu mon aymé beaufrere je suis ruyné, car j'ay totalement point de chance, mes bestailles a cornes se meurent, mes enfans se meurent aussy, je ne scay plus ce que je doibs commencer
notable_quotes.english: O God my beloved brother-in-law I am ruined, for I have totally no luck, my horned cattle are dying, my children are dying too, I no longer know what I should do
notable_quotes.context: Nicklass crying to Hanns Cordonnier about his losses before catching Sennelle at his stable door

notable_quotes.speaker: Synnelle femme Schneyder Hanns
notable_quotes.french: roman, laron et meschant, et qu'il ne poulroit jamais faire paroistre sur elle de ce qu'il la chargeoit qu'elle soit une sorciere, et que s'il peult trouver ung article sur Rooles ou Registre qu'elle soit esté accusée ou puisse estre sorciere qu'on la brusle, et qu'on la menoit à Dieuze parce qu'elle estoit pauvre et laissoit on les riches en la maison
notable_quotes.english: scoundrel, thief and wicked, and that he could never prove against her what he charged her with being a witch, and if he can find an article in the Rolls or Register that she has been accused or can be a witch let her be burned, and that she was being taken to Dieuze because she was poor and the rich were left at home
notable_quotes.context: after her arrest, speaking to her accuser

notable_quotes.speaker: Synnelle femme Schneyder Hanns
notable_quotes.french: qu'une partie couroient fort et qu'ilz poulroient bien estre fichéz plus avant en l'affaire qu'elle
notable_quotes.english: that some were running hard and they could well be stuck deeper in the affair than she
notable_quotes.context: to guards Philippe Bouleman and companion at Amange

notable_quotes.speaker: wife of Bitscher Symet (accused witch)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il s'en alle garder ceulx qui estoient en sa maison et qu'il y en trouveroit des jeunes et des vielles
notable_quotes.english: that he should go guard those who were in his house and he would find young ones and old ones there
notable_quotes.context: to husband of accused when he was guarding her 15 years earlier

notable_quotes.speaker: accused woman trying to escape
notable_quotes.french: qu'il regarde derrier son feu ce qu'il y avoit et qu'il n'avoit que faire de tant mener de bruyt
notable_quotes.english: that he should look behind his fire at what was there and he had no need to make so much noise
notable_quotes.context: to husband of Synnelle when he caught her trying to escape

notable_quotes.speaker: curé
notable_quotes.french: votre enfant est malade d'une mauvaise air chose asseurée qu'il en mourra
notable_quotes.english: your child is sick from a bad air, certain thing that he will die from it
notable_quotes.context: said to Catherine Fogel about her dying son

relationships.evidence_text: married with present husband Hanns Glock, cousturier, 'aupres duquel elle at enduré plusieurs fortunes maulx at ennuys', and kept house for 25 years
married Thomas le Baur of Amange, with whom she lived for 3 years. Widow 15 months, then remarried
daughter of Stockhanns and his wife Anne

relationships.person1: Synelle veuve du feu maitre d'école
relationships.evidence_text: Synelle veuve du feu maitre d'école
accused lived in house owned by prévôt and his wife - tenant/landlady relationship

economic_context.details: Clemens Hanns exercised retraite (property repurchase right) on house bought by husband of accused, after which he lost mares and foals. Multiple references to accused being poor - she said on cart 'qu'on la menoit à Dieuze parce qu'elle estoit pauvre et laissoit on les riches en la maison'. Jean Cailla rented pasture rights she had previously held. Catherine Fogel's servant reported Sennelle asking if they would take back the house she lived in (possible eviction threat). Accused said she had 'enduré plusieurs fortunes maulx at ennuys' with her husband.

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a well-documented trial with extensive witness testimony. Key points: (1) Accused was clearly known as a healer who made soups for sick people using herbs (armoise, morsure du diable) - this healing practice was central to multiple accusations. (2) Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on multiple statements about taking the poor while leaving rich alone, her complaints about hardship with husband, and property/pasture disputes. (3) Language region is French based on all testimony and quotes being in French. (4) The trial shows strong pattern of healing-gone-wrong accusations - people suspected her of causing illness, then called her to cure it. (5) There's some confusion in testimony about Mayette/Nicklass - accused said Mayette told her to use urine remedy, but witness 5 says it was Nicklass who caught her at door and Nicklass was dead. This may be testimony confusion. (6) Accomplices list is extensive - 15 people named at sabbat. (7) Change de Nancy was consulted twice - approved torture and approved death sentence. (8) Confession came immediately under torture (as soon as lifted clear of ground). (9) Notable that executioner of Puttelange called her 'manifest witch' - professional opinion. (10) René de Villier's role is interesting - he called her witch, was charged by her husband and imprisoned, then asked to be partie formelle from prison.
